result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Lee Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, plus costs and disbursements.  To be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain high school diploma, HSED or GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Parenting classes/counseling.  Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with Walmart at 222 N. Chicago Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI..
No contact with Lorelei H.
No controlled substances or alcohol.
No driving without a valid driver's license or valid occupational license.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.  
The Court advised defendant  that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Lee Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DRUG ABUSE CORRECTIONAL CENTER ATTN. STEPHANIE P.O.BOX 36 WINNEBAGO WI 54985

It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Central Records, and will be based upon actual release date.

It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 7 Judge McAdams
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (43 pages) commencing 04/15/15 GUILTY PLEA/ SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Tyler Lee Johnson not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial with ADA Heard.  Case is rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Tyler Lee Johnson not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance and requested a plea date.  Court granted same and ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyler Lee Johnson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Tyler Lee Johnson in custody.  Ronald Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL WAL-MART STORES IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY AND LORELEI H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyler Lee Johnson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Tyler Lee Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
